result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel James Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall pay fine + costs + $15 pymt plan fee at rate of $100/month commencing 9/15/15 and 15th of each month until paid in full. 
Failure to Pay = 11 days DCJ w/h&t

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

(12:59) Defendant Daniel James Gordon in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (jail only).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court enters NG plea; State heard on bond; Victim is present and wants contact; Court finds probable cause. RD 8/3/15 at 2:30pm & JT 8/29/15 at 8:30am in Br. 1; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
